intro: Canarium linguistipulum, commonly known as the New Zealand canarium, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey-green bark and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in terminal panicles. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains a single, hard seed. Canarium linguistipulum is often found in coastal and lowland forest habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
